TopicTitle: Zapy97's new state of the art unsafe craft of the week

Articles.Content:
hello this time i have made a new craft designed for conquereing the unimmaginable, no it isn't a space plane, rocket, or land rovers, this i present to you is the AA-32 Alligator.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32505[/ATTACH]

it can traverse the great lands of kerbin at the awesome high speeds of 30m/s, it can travel at the extreme speeds of 15m/s on water and finaly it can be torn apart by the tiniest bump in the road, and yet some how survive the drop from the far end of the run way, but the best part about it is that no matter the catastrophic event of a very bad attempt to pilot it correctly...

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32507[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32506[/ATTACH]

...It still keeps you kerbals safe and happy in the large cylindrical conning tower cunningly disgused as a MK1-2 command pod on a decopler on top of a large fuel tank wired to not quite so detonate.

on a serious not quite so business note the fastest i have gotten it was 100m/s on the runway, where it was ripped apart due to landing gear,

on water i got it to about 20m/s before being ripped apart,

on the grasses of kerbin i got it to about 10m/s due to the shoddy landing gear,

but on do not think after all of this calamity of crashes and failures of the structure all three of are kerbins where safe and unharmed.

as an after note when all of these .17, threads came up, people designing all these new "giant" rocket to get them places, i was instantly inspired to make a seafaring vessel that could cross oceans, well i ended up with a completely differant thing where it cant go above 10m/s without being ripped apart, but i thought it would be fun to share it on th forums with alittle funny commentary
that looks very nice! but is bad that it brakes only looking at it... you can post the .craft files too!
